vulnerabilities.title: Formidable relies on hexoid to prevent guessing of filenames for untrusted executable content
vulnerabilities.description: Formidable (aka node-formidable) 2.x before 2.1.3 and 3.x before 3.5.3 relies on hexoid to prevent guessing of filenames for untrusted executable content; however, hexoid is documented as not "cryptographically secure." (Also, there is a scenario in which only the last two characters of a hexoid string need to be guessed, but this is not often relevant.) NOTE: this does not imply that, in a typical use case, attackers will be able to exploit any hexoid behavior to upload and execute their own co

vulnerabilities.title: Formidable arbitrary file upload
vulnerabilities.description:
Withdrawn: This advisory was improperly assigned.

An arbitrary file upload vulnerability in formidable v3.2.4 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted filename.
